That's a text layout. I need the export string of the icon if you want me to help you with it.

Also, there is no need to make a comment on Curse if you also open a ticket. I deleted your comment on Curse - tickets make things much easier to keep track of for the both of us.

> Posted by CurseForge user clambake1

This is the result of the Multi-state cooldown icon type being removed. If you want it to function exactly like it did before, make a meta icon and add this icon as the second icon in the meta icon. As the first icon in the meta icon, make a condition icon that checks that Fire and Brimstone is active (i.e. you have the buff), and set its custom texture to Arcane Explosion.

Edited Nov 16, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank you for your help and you patience. I tried to follow your instructions but I am hopelessly confused. Should I make a new group with one icon in it, or should I change my existing fire and brimstone icon to meta. Should I make a group with two icons and make one meta and the other conditional? As you can tell I am totally inept at this and would need exact instruction in order to succeed.

I very much enjoy using your add-on and appreciate the time you put into this. It seems like a very simple thing, all I need is to be able to see when FnB is active but find the default ui too cluttered with buff/debuff icons.


> Posted by CurseForge user clambake1
